rotated.description: Show chart as a structure representation

showBaseChart.description: Whether the base chart is displayed

chartTypeBySeries.description: You may assign a chart type for each series separately

deviationsConfig.description: Configuration of deviation charts, rendered above/besides the base chart

deviationVisibility.description: Defines, which deviation charts are visible.

calculateDeviationsFromNull.description: If checked, deviations are also calculated from NULL values. By default, NULL values prevent a deviation calculation

deviationGoodColor.description: The color for 'good' deviations. Usually for positive values, if not inverted by 'Negative Deviation Is Good'.

deviationBadColor.description: The color for 'bad' deviations. Usually for negative values, if not inverted by 'Negative Deviation Is Good'.

deviationNeutralColor.description: Color for deviations, if the difference is 0.

negativeDeviationIsGood.description: If checked, positive and negative coloring is inverted

deviationBarSizeFactor.description: Width of deviation bars, proportional to width of bars in base chart. Only available if 'Scenarios In Deviations' is enabled.

deviationPinWidth.description: Pin width for line elements of percentage deviation charts

deviationPinLineBlack.description: Whether the line of percent deviation pins is black

showPinHeadColor.displayName: Use Pin Head Color in Deviations
showPinHeadColor.description: Use Custom Color In Pin Heads

pinHeadShape.description: Pin Head Shape for Deviation Charts

padding.description: Padding around the chart in pixels

spacing.description: Spacing between each of the base and deviation charts in pixels

spaceFactorBaseChart.description: Amount of space used for base charts, proportional to sum of all amounts

spaceFactorDeviationChart.description: Amount of space used for deviation charts, proportional to sum of all amounts

smallMultiplesNCount.description: Number of small multiples charts before applying 'Rest'

smallMultiplesMinWidth.description: Min Width for every small multiple chart

smallMultiplesMinHeight.description: Min Height for every small multiple chart

nRest.description: N + Rest calculation for a given dimension

seriesStyles.description: Default style of each series. Used, if no scenarios are defined.

visibleSeries.description: Which series are visible. Series may be hidden, but still be used for calculations.

scenariosBySeries.description: List of scenarios, one for each series. They are overruled by the series specific scenario assignment.

showDatatypesInAxis.description: Whether scenarios are rendered in category axis

legendEnabled.description: Whether the scenario legend is enabled or not. The legend only displays the default Series Styles or assignments made by Scenario by Series

scenariosInDeviations.description: Whether scenarios are applied to deviation charts

fadeOutOpacity.description: If a selection was made you can define the opacity of all other elements which are not selected

offsetPerSeries.description: If set, offsets are set per series

scenarioAssignment.description: Assigns scenarios to a data selection

elementsOffset.description: Offset of the elements in a category in pixels or percent

showCategoryAxis.description: Whether the category axis is displayed

fixedCategoryWidth.description: If checked, the category width is no longer allocated automatically, but 'Category Width' is used

categoryWidth.description: The width for fixed category width

categoryCount.description: If set above 0, no matter what data, this many categories are drawn

showValueAxis.description: Whether the value axis is displayed

flipValueAxis.description: If checked, the value axis is drawn on the right side

valueAxisTickDistance.description: Indication, how distant the value axis help lines are.

forceTickInterval.description: If set, value axis ticks are forced to be exactly the given value. By default, sensible values are determined.

valueAxisTicksWidth.description: Width of value axis ticks in pixels

separatorMode.description: Depending on this mode, separators are derived from: None, Category Labels, Scenarios of a Series, or manually

separatorSourceRowIndex.description: Depending on the separator mode, this means either: Category Labels Row or Scenario Series Index

separatorPositions.description: For separator mode manual, this provides the positions for the separators.

separatorLength.description: Length of axis separators in pixels

separatorThickness.description: Thickness of category axis separators in pixels

separatorsInFront.description: If checked, separators are drawn in front of the axis

minCategoryWidth.description: If the automatic category width would be below this value, the chart will scroll

useFormattedData.description: Use preformatted value texts, if available in data source.

labelFormatMode.description: Whether basic or extended(graphomate) number format is used for value label formats.

numberFormat.description: Number format string for element labels, see 'numeral.js' for details

numberFormatPercentage.description: Number format string for percent element labels, see 'numeral.js' for details

extendedNumberFormat.description: graphomate number format string for element labels, see docs for details.

extendedNumberFormatPercent.description: graphomate number format string for percent element labels, see docs for details.

signedLabels.description: If selected, positive values will have a leading '+'

nullValueReplacement.description: If not empty, this string will replace all NULL values

infinityValueReplacement.description: If not empty, this string will replace all infinity values

zeroValueReplacement.description: If not empty, this string will replace all zero values

suppressZeroLabels.description: If checked, zero labels are hidden

labelPositioningMode.description: Selects the position of element labels: No Labels, fix above elements or automatically positioned

collisionAdjustment.description: Adjustment inset for label collision in pixels

labelShadows.description: Enables a rectangle shaped background for value labels, to increase visibility

labelShadowColor.description: Color of the background of value labels

visibleElementLabels.description: This defines the visiblity of the element labels by series.

pickLabels.description: If enabled, labels are selectively shown, depending on picking settings.

forceFirstValueLabel.description: With label picking, this shows the first label of a series.

forceLastValueLabel.description: With label picking, this shows the last label of a series.

forceMinValueLabel.description: With label picking, this shows the minimum value label of a series.

forceMaxValueLabel.description: With label picking, this shows the maximum value label of a series.

forceBeforeSeparators.description: With label picking, all value labels before separators are shown.

forcePeakLabels.description: With label picking, this shows value labels after a large value shift.

minimumPeakSize.description: Minimum value shift size in percent, for a value to be picked; value between 0 and 1

checkOnlyLeadingValuesForPeaking.displayName: Check Only Leading Values For Peaking
checkOnlyLeadingValuesForPeaking.description: Only leading value shifts are considered for value picking.

fontFamily.description: Font family to be used; you can type in anything, but make sure, that the font is supported

fontColor.description: Font color for all labels except title; exceptions apply

title.description: Title to be displayed on top of the chart

showSeriesLabelsLeft.description: If checked, the elements are labeled on the left/top with the series name

showSeriesLabelsRight.description: If checked, the elements are labeled on the right/bottom with the series name

customSeriesLabels.description: If enabled can define your own series labels otherwise the series labels will be derived from assigned data

seriesLabels.description: Labels that are attached to series elements

maxSeriesLabelsWidth.description: Maximum width in pixels, series labels may occupy

categoryLabelsVisibility.description: If checked, category labels are visible for that level

maxCategoryLabelWidth.description: When in structure mode, this limits the space the category labels may occupy

suppressRepeatingCategoryLabels.description: If checked, category labels that are duplicated from the previous category, are hidden

hierarchicalLabelDisplay.description: If checked, category labels in structure orientation are shown hierarchically

splitSignForCategoryLabels.description: Character to be treated as line break in category labels

categoryLabelRotation.description: While the chart is in time representation, this rotates category labels by this amount.

displayDimensionKeys.description: Keys of the dimensions, that are displayed in the category labels

showAxisLabelsLeft.description: Whether labels next to category axis are shown left/top

showAxisLabelsRight.description: Whether labels next to category axis are shown right/bottom

axisLabels.description: Labels on the side of the category axis

lineBreakAxisLabel.description: Character to be treated as line break in axis labels

tooltipLabelFormatMode.description: Whether basic or extended(graphomate) number format is used for tooltip label formats.

tooltipNumberFormat.description: Number format string for tooltips. See numeral.js for details.

tooltipNumberFormatPercentage.description: Percent number format string for tooltips. See numeral.js for details.

tooltipExtendedNumberFormat.description: graphomate number format string for tooltip value labels, see docs for details.

tooltipExtendedNumberFormatPercent.description: graphomate number format string for tooltip percent value labels, see docs for details.

cropCategoryLabels.description: When in time mode, the maximum space category labels can occupy, is limited by the category width

customCss.description: CSS snippets which will be applied to the matrix. A perfect counterpart to the CFL when highly complex selectors are needed.

categoryLabelsFromMeasures.description: If measures names should be displayed in category labels

endingLineVisible.description: If checked, bars/columns are ended with a line

endingLineOverlap.description: How much the ending lines overlap the bar on each side in pixels

endingLineThickness.description: Thickness of ending lines in pixels

calcPath.description: One for each waterfall data point, induce certain data handlings and formattings, see docs

waterfallPlusColor.description: Color of waterfall bars marked '+' in waterfall calculation path

waterfallMinusColor.description: Color of waterfall bars marked '-' in waterfall calculation path

waterfallSumColor.description: Color of waterfall bars marked '=' in waterfall calculation path

waterfallNeutralColor.description: Color of waterfall bars marked '0' in waterfall calculation path

waterfallSpanPlusColor.description: Color of waterfall bars marked 's+' in waterfall calculation path

waterfallSpanMinusColor.description: Color of waterfall bars marked 's-' in waterfall calculation path

lineDotRadiusX.description: Radius of the line dot shape in X direction

lineDotRadiusY.description: Radius of the line dot shape in Y direction

pinWidth.description: Pin width for line elements of pin chart

pinHeadRadiusX.description: Radius of the pin head shape in X direction

pinHeadRadiusY.description: Radius of the pin head shape in Y direction

pinHeadMode.description: Whether pin heads are drawn in front or behind pin lines.

stackedBarMode.description: Selects different modes for stacked bar chart calculation. Consult docs for details.

barWidth.description: Bar width for stacked bar chart

stackedBarSumsVisible.description: Stacked bar sums are hidden, if unchecked

stackedBarLabelPosition.description: Labels of stacked bars can be shown beneath the bar

showOffsetsOnLeft.description: Whether the offset bars are displayed on the left side

offsetbarDeviationLabelsOnTop.displayName: Offset Bar Deviations Labels On Top
offsetbarDeviationLabelsOnTop.description: If checked, all offset bar deviation labels are drawn on top

offsetbarLabelsOnTop.description: If checked, all offset bar labels are drawn on top

applyDotColorsToLines.description: The same color used on line dots will be applied to the corresponding lines

thresholdLinesConfig.description: List of configuration objects for reference lines

highlightMode.description: Whether and which highlight to show

highlightLabelPercentage.description: If checked, highlights show the deviation as percent

highlightLabelAbsolute.description: If checked, highlights show the deviation as absolute

highlightStartSeries.description: Series index of the single highlight start

highlightEndSeries.description: Series index of the single highlight end

highlightStartIndex.description: Element index of the single highlight start

highlightEndIndex.description: Element index of the single highlight end

highlightGroup.description: Components with highlight group enabled, highlight similar member combinations across components.

highlightGroupMatchMeasures.description: Whether the highlight group matches for similar measures, or only non-measure members are considered.

highlightGroupColor.description: The color highlighted elements are framed by.

userHighlights.description: Configuration object for user triggered highlights

userHighlightCol.description: An array of colors, which are toggled by user ALT+click

scaleMode.description: Choice between automatic or manual scale mode

manualScaleMax.description: Scale maximum for base chart in scale mode manual

manualScaleMin.description: Scale minimum for base chart in scale mode manual

manualScalePercentMax.description: Scale maximum of percent charts, if scale mode is manual

manualScalePercentMin.description: Scale minimum of percent charts, if scale mode is manual

comparisonGroup.description: Assign any name; all components with same comparison group scale and behave in sync

synchronizePadding.description: If checked, the padding is synchronized with comparison group

synchronizeScaling.description: If checked, the scaling is synchronized with comparison group

synchronizeAxesPosition.description: If checked, the axes positions are synchronized with comparison group

useOutlierThreshold.description: If checked, negative and positive outlier thresholds are applied.

outlierMode.description: Chooses the type of outlier rendering. Short or long.

positiveOutlierThreshold.description: Values above this threshold are treated as outliers; beware, this does not apply to deviation charts!

negativeOutlierThreshold.description: Values below this threshold are treated as outliers; beware, this does not apply to deviation charts!

positiveOutlierThresholdPercent.description: Percent values above this threshold are treated as outliers; beware: this may be overridden by comparison group!

negativeOutlierThresholdPercent.description: Percent values below this threshold are treated as outliers; beware: this may be overridden by comparison group!

scalingHelper.description: The mode of the scaling helper: None, Line Type or Area Type

scalingHelperValue.description: The value, at which the scaling helper is drawn

scalingHelperBarColor.description: Color of the line type scaling helper

scalingHelperBarLineWidth.description: Line width for scaling helper bar in pixels

scalingHelperAreaColor.description: Color of the area type scaling helper

comparisonGroupType.description: How the comparison group communicates. Direct of via local storage.

comparisonGroupEnvironmentId.description: Identifies the environment (e.g. dashboard ID) of the websocket comparisongroup to prevent cross dashboard scaling

serverUrl.description: URL where your instance of the graphomate server can be found

templateName.description: The name of the chart template, that has been loaded and applied

pngExportAvailable.description: Show an icon top right to trigger PNG export

rulesets.description: Rulesets to be loaded from the server and applied to this charts

commentingBackendServerUrl.description: URL for the graphomate comments server

staticContexts.description: Context for which the comment is shown

dynamicContexts.description: Context for which the comment is shown

dataPointCommentRepresentation.description: Representation of the Data Point Comments

bindDataPointCommentsToInstance.displayName: Bind Data Point Comments to Instance
bindDataPointCommentsToInstance.description: Activating this Flag assigns Data Point Comments only to this Visualisation

commentingShowAuthoringInformation.description: Show creation or changed author and timestamp

commentingMoreCommentsExpandable.description: If deactivated more comments are shown directly without click

commentingInitialText.description: Text to be shown when there is no comment for the current Contexts

commentingHiddenContexts.description: Contexts which should be hidden from the UI

commentingShowMenuEdge.description: Show Menu Edge for User name and Logout

randomId.description: Used to identify an instance of a component

allPropertiesCache.description: JSON Property containing all property values for using them when power bi hasn't updated the capabilities after a release
